answers.answer: Yep I had to have an extra ultrasound when I was 28 weeks because I was measuring 34 weeks they just checked the baby head body and limb sizes and if there's the right amount of fluid in the uterus :) they didn't change my due date though I'm now 36 weeks measuring 37+4
Yes I'm measuring 2 weeks bigger idk if this means she'll come sooner
I hope it means he comes sooner!!
I rather him come when im 40 weeks

Just because fundal height or fetal weight is bigger than expected doesn't mean they'll come sooner.   Baby can be "bigger" due to genetics or gestational diabetes. They still need be "in the oven" long enough.
I had a ten pound baby at 38 weeks. Bigger babies don't come early just because they are big unfortunately...
I know and I don't have gestational diabetes I just want this pregnancy to hurry up haha wow 10 pounds!! Did you deliver naturally?
I am 28w measuring 30w. I am having a boy and all the boys in my family are really tall. So could be genetics. :)

I've been measuring big since 28 weeks (I'm now 35 weeks). I've been getting sonograms more frequently. At first I was measuring 6 weeks bigger but now I'm only measuring 3 weeks bigger, my due date hasn't changed which isn't concerning my doctor so I'm not worried if she isn't.

Due date should not be changed regardless of fetal size or fundal height. If the pregnancy is "well dated" by a known and reliable LMP or accurate 1st trimester scan it stays throughout the gestation.

question: Wow I actually have to have a ultrasound soon before my next two week apointment my baby boy is measuring big has anyone else experience this?
title: 32 weeks baby measuring big
